body:
Thanks @mrry. Actually my intention was to allow label to match any shape (e.g., `[3, 2]`) from input. However, there was one bug in the previous update that uses `TensorShape({input_flat.size()})`. Now the PR has been updated using `input_tensor->shape()` and the issue should be resolved.

I added an additional test case to show that an input tensor of shape `[3, 2]` works as well. (as opposed to a vector).
body_html:
Thanks @mrry. Actually my intention was to allow label to match any shape (e.g., [3, 2]) from input. However, there was one bug in the previous update that uses TensorShape({input_flat.size()}). Now the PR has been updated using input_tensor->shape() and the issue should be resolved.

I added an additional test case to show that an input tensor of shape [3, 2] works as well. (as opposed to a vector).
body_text:
Thanks @mrry. Actually my intention was to allow label to match any shape (e.g., [3, 2]) from input. However, there was one bug in the previous update that uses TensorShape({input_flat.size()}). Now the PR has been updated using input_tensor->shape() and the issue should be resolved.
I added an additional test case to show that an input tensor of shape [3, 2] works as well. (as opposed to a vector).
